greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a[n] = a[(n - a[n-1])*(1-mod[n, 2])+a[n-1]*(mod[n, 2])] + a[(n - a[n-2])*(1-mod[n, 2]) +(n-a[n-1])*(mod[n, 2 ])] with a[1] = a[2] = 1.
comment: A Batrachian sequence that switches between Conway's and Hofstadter's sequences modulo 2.
mathematica: Hc[n_Integer?Positive] := Hc[n] =Hc[(n - Hc[n-1])*(1-Mod[n, 2])+Hc[n-1]*(Mod[n, 2])] + Hc[(n - Hc[n-2])*(1-Mod[n, 2])+(n-Hc[n-1])*(Mod[n, 2])] Hc[1] = Hc[2] = 1 Terms =202 a=Table[Hc[n], {n, 1, Terms }]
xref: Cf. A004001, A005185. Complement gives A086451.
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Sep 01 2003
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 25 2006
